Hud

The class that controls most of the direct manipulation tasks available within the extension.

Summary
Hud
The class that controls most of the direct manipulation tasks available within the extension.
Functions
Hud
Initializes the Object
init
This function initialize the hud with its default attributes; and checks to see if this is the first time the extension has been used by the player.
cycle_toolbar_mode
This function will cycle through a series of settings for displaying toolbar buttons.
choose_skin
This function chooses the skin of the extension based on the value stored in the skin preference.
set_skin
This function stores the chosen skin in a preference for later.
add_xul_tooltip
Interestingly most xul elements don’t natively allow you to specify onmouseover events like you can in the HTML DOM.
set_avatar
This function updates the avatar area of the hud with the image returned by the remote server.
find_skin
Finds the name of a skin from a switch statement.
toggle_hud
Toggles the hud visible or hidden depending on the hud’s current setting.
display_flash
The flash is a xul node, which can be used to display a message to the user.
help
This function will open a tab in the browser to the help url on the PMOG server.
shoppe
This function will open a tab in the browser to the shoppe url on the PMOG server.
buy
This function opens the shoppe to the page of the supplied tool Parameters:
learn_about
This function opens the correct page of the codex associated with the topic passed in
deploy
This function will initiate a deploy request for whatever tool is provided as a parameter.
deploy_armor
This function toggles armor on or off depending on its current state.
edit_lightpost
This function opens a browser window to the player’s lightpost page.
visit_toolbar_help
Opens a browser tab to the toolbar help page.
visit_mailbox
Opens a browser tab to the players mailbox
visit_contacts
Opens a browser tab to the friends page
preferences
This function opens a xul preference window.
ignored_sites
This function opens a xul window displaying sites for PMOG to ignore.
Make Mission
Find Mission
report a bug
This function opens a xul window to submit a bug to pmog.
manage_profiles
This function displays a dialog that allows users to manage their preferences by clearing passwords and preferences at will.
profile
This function opens a browser window to the current player’s profile page.
register
This function opens a browser window to pmog registration page.
visit_pmog
This function opens a browser window to the root pmog url.
acquaintances
This function opens a browser window to the current player’s acquaintances page.
missions
This function opens a browser window to the current player’s missions page.
switch_users
This function logs the current user out and brings down the login box so that a user can log in as someone else.
level_up_help
This function opens a browser to a page, that contains explainations of how to level up.
codex_pmogeus
This function opens a browser to the codex page on pmog.com
play
Resume play of the game and unhide the hidden pmog tools and event windows.
pause
Pause the game playback, hide the pmog toolbar and event windows.
hide_all
Hide the entire pmog window and show the login window.
show_all
Show the entire pmog window and hide the login window.
hide_tools
Certain actions like finding page objects only require the tools to be hidden not the entire hud.
show_tools
Once a player is authenticated by the server and an instance of the PmogUser class has been assigned, this method will show the tools in the hud.
update_login_status_message
This function displays a text message in the login toolbox.
update_pmog_game_notice
This function displays a text message in the status message element.
update_pmog_player_notice
This function displays a text message in the status message element.
sign_out
This function signs the user out of the extension and the website by making an asynchronous call to the pmog server.
check_for_updates
This function will compare the version parameter with the extension’s version as designated by the version attribute of the install.rdf file.
auto_login
If the player’s credentials are stored withing firefox then this method will attempt to use them to automatically log the user into PMOG and start playing the page.
login
This function allows the player to attempt to sign into Pmog only after they’ve supplied a username and password to the extension through a message prompt.
login_result
This function is used as a callback for the login attempt.
update_venture_menu
This function will display a button to take a user on a random mission from their queue.
update_switch_users_menu
This function will display the currently logged in user next to the switch users menu item in the “P” menu.
update_acquaintances_menu
This function will query the pmog server for the info for each of their buddies, which will be displayed in the IM window menu.
openAndReuseOneTabPerURL
This function will open a url in a new or existing tab depending if a tab is already open containing the requested url.
parse_xul
Extract the location of important items of the hud into variables so that we only have to look them up once.
update_pmog_toolbar
Find the xul element for the pmog toolbar and iterate over the child nodes looking for elements which match attributes of the user object.
parse_user_associations
This function styles the childnodes of a xul element to match the player’s associations.
show_association_page
This function opens a browser to the association of the provided parameter.
pmog_reset
This function reboots PMOG as if the user just logged in.
delete_all_logins
Delete all the logins stored for the PMOG domain, and then log out.
reset_all_preferences
Reset all the logins stored for the PMOG domain, and then log out.

Functions

Hud

Hud = function()

Initializes the Object

init

Hud.prototype.init = function()

This function initialize the hud with its default attributes; and checks to see if this is the first time the extension has been used by the player.  It also creates an instance of the PmogSessionManager to handle auto login if the user allowed their login credientials to be saved by Firefox.

cycle_toolbar_mode

Hud.prototype.cycle_toolbar_mode = function(key)

This function will cycle through a series of settings for displaying toolbar buttons.  The possible modes are:

  • icons: Show only icons.
  • text: Show only text.
  • full: Show both.

choose_skin

Hud.prototype.choose_skin = function()

This function chooses the skin of the extension based on the value stored in the skin preference.

set_skin

Hud.prototype.set_skin = function(skin)

This function stores the chosen skin in a preference for later.

Parameters

skinA string containing the name of the chosen skin.

add_xul_tooltip

Hud.prototype.add_xul_tooltip = function(element,
tooltip_id)

Interestingly most xul elements don’t natively allow you to specify onmouseover events like you can in the HTML DOM.  It appears that listeners must be used instead.  This method allows you to display desired tooltip though the application of a listener object.

Parameters

idthe id of the menu item to apply the mouseover event to.
tooltip_idthe menu to update

set_avatar

Hud.prototype.set_avatar = function(element,
src)

This function updates the avatar area of the hud with the image returned by the remote server.

Parameters

srcA string specifying the remote location of the avatar image.

find_skin

Hud.prototype.find_skin = function(skin)

Finds the name of a skin from a switch statement.  This function is used to ensure an incorrect skin name is chosen.

Parameters

skinString of skin

Returns

Returns the name of the chosen skin or a default if the chosen skin is not a valid skin name.

toggle_hud

Hud.prototype.toggle_hud = function()

Toggles the hud visible or hidden depending on the hud’s current setting.

display_flash

Hud.prototype.display_flash = function(message,
type)

The flash is a xul node, which can be used to display a message to the user.  The flash is best used to display status or error messages, that cannot be rendered to the DOM for example, when there is no page loaded.

Parameters

messageA string to display in the body of the flash.
typeA string which is either info, warn, or critical

help

Hud.prototype.help = function(event)

This function will open a tab in the browser to the help url on the PMOG server.

shoppe

Hud.prototype.shoppe = function(event)

This function will open a tab in the browser to the shoppe url on the PMOG server.

buy

Hud.prototype.buy = function(tool,
event)

This function opens the shoppe to the page of the supplied tool Parameters:

toolString representing the tool to buy
eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

learn_about

Hud.prototype.learn_about = function(topic,
event)

This function opens the correct page of the codex associated with the topic passed in

Parameters

topicString representing the topic to learn about
eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

deploy

Hud.prototype.deploy = function(tool,
event)

This function will initiate a deploy request for whatever tool is provided as a parameter.

Parameters

toolThe tool to deploy
eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

deploy_armor

Hud.prototype.deploy_armor = function()

This function toggles armor on or off depending on its current state.  If the user does not have any armor then nothing happens.

edit_lightpost

Hud.prototype.edit_lightpost = function(event)

This function opens a browser window to the player’s lightpost page.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

visit_toolbar_help

Hud.prototype.visit_toolbar_help = function(event)

Opens a browser tab to the toolbar help page.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

visit_mailbox

Hud.prototype.visit_mailbox = function(event)

Opens a browser tab to the players mailbox

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

visit_contacts

Hud.prototype.visit_contacts = function(event)

Opens a browser tab to the friends page

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

preferences

Hud.prototype.preferences = function()

This function opens a xul preference window.

ignored_sites

Hud.prototype.ignored_sites = function()

This function opens a xul window displaying sites for PMOG to ignore.

Make Mission

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

Find Mission

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

report a bug

This function opens a xul window to submit a bug to pmog.

manage_profiles

Hud.prototype.manage_profiles = function()

This function displays a dialog that allows users to manage their preferences by clearing passwords and preferences at will.

profile

Hud.prototype.profile = function(event)

This function opens a browser window to the current player’s profile page.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

register

Hud.prototype.register = function(event)

This function opens a browser window to pmog registration page.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

visit_pmog

Hud.prototype.visit_pmog = function(event)

This function opens a browser window to the root pmog url.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

acquaintances

Hud.prototype.acquaintances = function(event)

This function opens a browser window to the current player’s acquaintances page.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

missions

Hud.prototype.missions = function(event)

This function opens a browser window to the current player’s missions page.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

switch_users

Hud.prototype.switch_users = function(user)

This function logs the current user out and brings down the login box so that a user can log in as someone else.

Parameters

userString containing the login of the user to switch to.  If user is null it will display the login prompt.

level_up_help

Hud.prototype.level_up_help = function(event)

This function opens a browser to a page, that contains explainations of how to level up.

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

codex_pmogeus

Hud.prototype.codex_pmogeus = function(event)

This function opens a browser to the codex page on pmog.com

Parameters

eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

play

Hud.prototype.play = function()

Resume play of the game and unhide the hidden pmog tools and event windows.

pause

Hud.prototype.pause = function()

Pause the game playback, hide the pmog toolbar and event windows.

hide_all

Hud.prototype.hide_all = function(msg)

Hide the entire pmog window and show the login window.  This is used for sequences like login where we don’t want the user to interact with anything on the toolbar.

show_all

Hud.prototype.show_all = function()

Show the entire pmog window and hide the login window.

hide_tools

Hud.prototype.hide_tools = function(msg)

Certain actions like finding page objects only require the tools to be hidden not the entire hud.

show_tools

Hud.prototype.show_tools = function()

Once a player is authenticated by the server and an instance of the PmogUser class has been assigned, this method will show the tools in the hud.

update_login_status_message

Hud.prototype.update_login_status_message = function(msg)

This function displays a text message in the login toolbox.

Parameters

msgA string of text to display in the login toolbox.

update_pmog_game_notice

Hud.prototype.update_pmog_game_notice = function(msg)

This function displays a text message in the status message element.

Parameters

msgA string of text to display in the main toolbox.

update_pmog_player_notice

Hud.prototype.update_pmog_player_notice = function(msg)

This function displays a text message in the status message element.

Parameters

msgA string of text to display in the main toolbox.

sign_out

Hud.prototype.sign_out = function()

This function signs the user out of the extension and the website by making an asynchronous call to the pmog server.  It also sets a boolean preference to specify the user is no longer playing and hides all the presently open event windows.

check_for_updates

Hud.prototype.check_for_updates = function(version)

This function will compare the version parameter with the extension’s version as designated by the version attribute of the install.rdf file.  If a new version is available the flash will display an upgrade notice.

Parameters

versionstring, which is to be compared against the extension’s version.

auto_login

Hud.prototype.auto_login = function()

If the player’s credentials are stored withing firefox then this method will attempt to use them to automatically log the user into PMOG and start playing the page.

login

Hud.prototype.login = function(user)

This function allows the player to attempt to sign into Pmog only after they’ve supplied a username and password to the extension through a message prompt.

Parameters

userString of the username to log in as, if a string is not provided it will attempt to log in using the current_user preference if available.

login_result

Hud.prototype.login_result = function(user,
response_obj)

This function is used as a callback for the login attempt.  The PmogSessionManager will call this function and pass back the user object and the JSON object containing all other information sent as part of the login process.

Parameters

userContains an instance of the PmogUser class.
response_objcontains other info for login like the MOTD

update_venture_menu

Hud.prototype.update_venture_menu = function(user)

This function will display a button to take a user on a random mission from their queue.

Parameters

userThe user object, which contains the login to use.

update_switch_users_menu

Hud.prototype.update_switch_users_menu = function(user,
other_logins)

This function will display the currently logged in user next to the switch users menu item in the “P” menu.

Parameters

userThe user object, which contains the login to use.

update_acquaintances_menu

Hud.prototype.update_acquaintances_menu = function(user)

This function will query the pmog server for the info for each of their buddies, which will be displayed in the IM window menu.

Parameters

userThe user object, which contains an array of buddies.

openAndReuseOneTabPerURL

Hud.prototype.openAndReuseOneTabPerURL = function(url,
event)

This function will open a url in a new or existing tab depending if a tab is already open containing the requested url.

Parameters

urlString containing url to load in the browser
eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

parse_xul

Hud.prototype.parse_xul = function()

Extract the location of important items of the hud into variables so that we only have to look them up once.

update_pmog_toolbar

Hud.prototype.update_pmog_toolbar = function(user)

Find the xul element for the pmog toolbar and iterate over the child nodes looking for elements which match attributes of the user object.  If the element exists then assign it the correct value from the user object

Parameters

userInstance of the PmogUser class.

parse_user_associations

Hud.prototype.parse_user_associations = function(xul,
user)

This function styles the childnodes of a xul element to match the player’s associations.

Parameters

xulXUL node containg child nodes where the user associations are to be displayed.
userInstance of the PmogUser class.

show_association_page

Hud.prototype.show_association_page = function(association,
event)

This function opens a browser to the association of the provided parameter.

Parameters

associationString containing the assocation to display.
eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

pmog_reset

Hud.prototype.pmog_reset = function()

This function reboots PMOG as if the user just logged in.

delete_all_logins

Hud.prototype.delete_all_logins = function()

Delete all the logins stored for the PMOG domain, and then log out.

reset_all_preferences

Hud.prototype.reset_all_preferences = function()

Reset all the logins stored for the PMOG domain, and then log out.

This class stores all the attributes needed by the player during the normal course of play.

This function displays a text message in the login toolbox.
Hud.prototype.update_pmog_game_notice = function(msg)
This function displays a text message in the status message element.

This function displays a text message in the status message element.

This function allows the player to attempt to sign into Pmog only after they’ve supplied a username and password to the extension through a message prompt.

Hud.prototype.reset_all_preferences = function()
Reset all the logins stored for the PMOG domain, and then log out.
This class handles the authentication, the storing and retrieving of local login credentials and session handling of Pmog players.
